text:
@Judy Hogan Trump is not lying to us. It is exceptionally hard for rational people to have conversations with you Lefties, BTW. It's so hard, I promised myself that I would not make the statement that I just made, but I cannot help it. It's like trying to let a bird out of the house through front-door as it keeps ramming its head against window pane. It's annoying...but I digress.

Corporations in the USA buy products in China, then sell those products to Americans. The spread between the buy price from China and the sell price in the USA, is their profit. When a gadget is cheaper in China, that is, generally, NOT good for the USA. The USA, as a whole, loses money when that happens. The reason is that any profit that the Chinese get by selling that widget to an American corporation goes directly into the pockets of China. 

If you understand the concept of wealth, then you understand what's going on. Take trade deficit. Let's say it's $500 billion. This means that the "cash register" for all of China, when selling junk to the USA, shows yearly total of of say, $1.3 trillion. The cash register when USA sells to China will be, say, $800 billion. This is where the $500 billion number comes from. Assume an average profit on each widget (marginal profit) of 10%. This means that China is sucking $50 billion worth of WEALTH from the USA, each year, no matter what. PERIOD. There is no economic model where this is not true (If you are an economist...shut-up...I know about the exceptions, trying to explain something here).

Trump wants that $50 billion/year to stay in the USA, or better yet, we "win" by, say, $10 billion a year. If China were to allow its currency to float, according to market forces, all the prices of crap in China would skyrocket naturally. I don't have time to explain why here, but if you connect two tanks of water, one high-water, one low-water, together, at their bases, by a hose, over time , water will eventually flow from high-water tank to low-water tank, naturally, until levels are in equilibrium. What China is doing with subsidies and currency-manipulation is preventing the equalization. They do this because it allows them to bleed wealth out of the USA.

About the idiot farmer: Yes, China will raise the prices, but, over time (I estimate 20 months), it will NOT cost Americans more. The reason is that those gadgets will be made here at HIGHER prices. Before you Lefties have an I-TOLD-YOU-SO!! fit, the prices are not really higher. I have a meeting to go to, so, again, I cannot explain things that you should know if you're over the age of 20, but basically, all the prices AND wages in the USA will readjust, automatically, so that though the prices are higher, the pay rates are higher, making them effectively lower.

I had a talk with a friend who owns a Mexican restaurant yesterday, and told all of the staff about their business, without seeing their books...about how it's busy, they cannot find people...then I proceeded to explain to them why it was happening (Trump).

Trump knows what he's doing. This farmer is an idiot who uses words like stochastics to hide his ignorance.

text:
The big picture reality here is that many of our institutions are so detrimental to natural selection and a stable evolutionary process, that they all have to be shut down, or turned upside-down, or utterly re-thought.  Basically substituting sustainable policy for "growth markets" and constant expansion and exploitation of finite resources.  The "Green New Deal" starts down that path, but when people understand how much change is required, it becomes  clear that "we the people" could never cooperate intellectually and materially to pull it off.  Not a hope in hell.
None the less, in the interests of a futile effort to 'save the planet', these large farms have to go anyway.
Biologically they are already on life support, having denuded the soils of nutrients, and growing crops in industrial quantities that rely on 'intravenous' supplies of fertilizers and nutrients, or they would die in that barren ground.  The rains and droughts are 'having' their way with that soil, that blows away in the wind and washes away during floods.  And the floods will come every year, each year worse than the last.
Maybe it's time to wind up the whole thing anyway?
Our last communities will be pockets, large and small who have learned how to live sustainably, because they have to.  If they can't produce it, they won't have it.  Generate it, grow it, consume it where you are going to use it, or where you live.  The whole concept of growing beans in America and selling them in China is crazy.  Anyone can see that.  That's why we have Global Warming.

text:
Pres. Trump doesn't even take a salary, and Sen. Tom Cotton is only new to the Senate and a veteran of Iraq, so not sure who are the "people with money" to whom you‚Äôre referring. 

We'd all prefer to have the China farm market back, but not at the cost of the rest of our economy. We need to stop hemorrhaging dollars to China. 

The tariff money China is now paying just gets passed along to the American consumer, and a lot of it gets paid to American farmers as subsidies, but it's also causing economic dislocation in China and resuscitating America's industrial base. Remember, China needs our consumers more than we need its widgits. 

But the PRC is also a top-down totalitarian mercantilist system now organized along fascist state corporatist lines, which means it can withstand a lot of popular discontent by stifling dissent and using repression. The U.S. Government is more responsive to the popular will, which is what the Chinese government is now trying to target through its retaliatory measures. Farmers have every right to complain, but they also should know they are playing into Beijing's hand when they do so.

We need to protect our farmers through subsidies and other measures. But we also need to win the economic war China began waging against us over 20 years ago. We surely will, if we just stand behind Pres. Trump. The tide is already turning in our favor.
author: Richard Pruett

text: @Richard Pruett no its not a tariff war is only hurting the consumer it doesnt effect the govs involved at all as you would know if you listened to literally every single economist who said as much when he started this pointless hardman act because that is what this is its trump trying to act like a hardman because he doesnt have a spine.............all this is doing is killing the farmers and losing jobs to other countries thanks to increased prices in raw materials making manufacturing harder and more expensive and as for the "he doesnt take a salary" he "gave" away his first check but havent really heard what he did with the rest of it and he only allowed the park service to use that money to maintain war memorials and nothing else so it was not really done out of the goodness of his heart anyway and more a political stunt
author: Andrew Barnett

text:
Andrew Barnett, you would know if you read my statement with any comprehension that I already conceded that the costs of tariffs are simply passed along to the consumer. But it's also true that the tariffs are causing economic dislocation in China and spurring the re-growth of U.S. industry. Moreover, it is the U.S. consumer who has been paying the cost of Chinese intellectual property theft, and the U.S. worker who has been losing his job to overseas relocations, and American families who stand to lose their sons and daughters if China ever believes itself materially and technologically strong enough to defeat the United States through military conflict.

A trade war is better than a shooting war. And anyway, Beijing started it. We should have retaliated much sooner, but now that we have a strong economy is also a good time.

In addition, if you had bothered to do any simple research before showing your ignorance, you'd already know that Pres. Trump writes a personal check each quarter in an amount equivalent to one-fourth of his annual salary.  Early recipients included the Department of Education, the National Park Service, the Department of Health and Human Services, the Department of Transportation, the Department of Veterans Affairs, the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism, and the Department of Homeland Security. 

Perhaps you'd care to match his generosity by endorsing your welfare check to a local farmer.

text:
I have no sympathy for Americans...PERIOD. First, the man lies and colludes with foreign powers hostile to U.S. interests. He insults veterans and their families, people who lost everything when their loved one died for their countries. Trump shamefully wimped out quipping: "What? You think I am crazy, I wasn't going to Vietnam." So he got an unscrupulous doctor to give him a note for Shin Splints. I got shin splints in Basic Training, mostly due to the extreme exercise and heavy packs we had to carry. I Took some anti-inflammatories and wore a stocking on the afflicted leg. Don't think I even got a day off from P.T. This man lies about nearly every aspect of his life, he cheats at golf, he is phony as a 3 dollar bill and the American People elected him. Oh, I know he didn't win the popular vote, but that only makes it worse. He cheated his way into the White House and accepted help from an enemy. AND YOU PEOPLE ELECTED HIM. Christ nearly 40% of you would do it again. How do the rest of us respect that? Anyone who votes for Trump subsequently, knowing what we know now and what we are likely to discover over the next year or so, you are a traitor if you vote for or support him. He is a racist bigot and a truly hate-filled human being, he has no business being in charge of the world's largest nuclear arsenal. Why you people are not in the streets demanding his ouster, is the very reason I have no sympathy for Americans. You are getting exactly what you deserve. Shame on you.


"All evil needs to succeed is for righteous men to do nothing."

text: Oh, they have always loved welfare for the rich...they just call it something else like "Tax Relief", "Subsidy", "Research Grant",  "Economic Stimulus", etc.and then they justify it with "Trickle Down" and "Growth Projections". The kind of Socialism Sanders wants is not a matter of government handing out more, it is a matter of handing it out where it is needed and where it actually will be an investment in the future.  And, what Sanders wants is not a government takeover of the means of production or discarding free-market capitalism...he just wants it regulated enough to keep it fair and to keep us safe.

text: The Blood of Ogun: As an outsider, I partially disagree with you. The choice between waffling Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump was a tough one. Whilst it was perhaps more obvious to we outsiders that Trump was full of hot air, the light burns dimmest at the base of the candle. So I can understand why Mr. Christopher Gibbs voted for Trump based on the reasons he noted. However, I do feel that those who continue to support Trump at this juncture do perhaps deserve everything they get. By now, it should be apparent that he is incapable and a culpable lier of the most extreme proportions even for politicians who have always spoken in half-truths and innuendo and will continue to do so. However, looking from afar, the Democratic Party still does not appear to have grasped that they are still relatively weak and without a strong leader. That creates a dangerous situation where Trump may very well be elected to a second term. A second term for someone like Trump is extremely dangerous as he will no longer be under pressure to garner votes and he will see reelection as carte blanche for executing the most extreme of his ideas. There is also the possibility that he will improve in the second term as he will no longer need to appeal to his base, but I think that you and I will perhaps agree that this scenario is unlikely. In any case, the people of the United States who oppose Trump need to prevent his reelection at all costs but you will not achieve it by knocking and bashing people who voted for Trump on social media.
